text:
$$
\begin{array}{r l}&{\left[\overline{{Y}}=\cfrac{1}{R}+\cfrac{1}{L_{1}\cdot\omega\cdot j}+\cfrac{1}{L_{2}\cdot\omega\cdot j}-\cfrac{C_{1}\cdot\omega}{j}-\cfrac{C_{2}\cdot\omega}{j}\right.}\ &{\left.\left[\overline{{Y}}=\cfrac{1}{R}+j\cdot\left[(C_{1}+C_{2})-\left(\cfrac{1}{L_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{L_{2}}\right)\right]\right.\right.}\end{array}
$$
The circuit behave as if has a parallel equivalent capacityC 
$$
{\mathsf{C}}={\mathsf{C}}_{1}+{\mathsf{C}}_{2}
$$
and a parallel equivalent inductance L 
$$
\begin{array}{l}{\displaystyle\left\{\frac{1}{L}=\frac{1}{L_{1}}+\frac{1}{L_{2}}\right.}\ {\displaystyle\left.L=\frac{L_{1}L_{2}}{L_{1}+L_{2}}\right.}\end{array}
$$
The complex admittance of the circuit may be written as 
$$
\overline{{\mathsf{Y}}}=\frac{1}{R}+\boldsymbol{j}\cdot\left(\mathsf{C}\cdot\omega-\frac{1}{L\cdot\omega}\right)
$$
and the complex impedance of the circuit wil be 
$$
\left\{\begin{array}{l l}{\displaystyle\overline{{\overline{{Z}}}}=\frac{1}{\overline{{\overline{{Y}}}}}}\ {\displaystyle\overline{{\overline{{Z}}}}=\frac{\frac{1}{R}+j\cdot\left(\frac{1}{L\cdot\omega}-C\cdot\omega\right)}{\sqrt{\left(\frac{1}{R}\right)^{2}+\left(C\cdot\omega-\frac{1}{L\cdot\omega}\right)^{2}}}}\end{array}\right.
$$
The impedance Zof the circuit, the inverse of the admittance of the circuit $\curlyvee$ isthemodulusof the compleximpedanceZ 
$$
Z=\left|{\overline{{Z}}}\right|={\frac{1}{\sqrt{\left({\frac{1}{R}}\right)^{2}+\left({C\cdot\omega-{\frac{1}{L\cdot\omega}}}\right)^{2}}}}={\frac{1}{Y}}
$$
The constant current source supplying the circuit furnish a current having a momentary value i(t) 
$$
i(t)=I\cdot\sqrt{2}\cdot\sin(\omega\cdot t),
$$
where $I$ is the effective intensity (constant), of the current and $\omega$ is the current pulsation (that can vary). The potential diference at the jacks of the circuit has the momentary value $u(t)$ 
$$
u(t)=U\cdot\sqrt{2}\cdot\sin(\omega\cdot t+\varphi)
$$
where $U$ is the effectivevalueof thetension and $\varphi$ is thephase difference betweentension and current. 
The effective values of the current and tension obey the relation
